Note: For watching the YouTube videos , the sound is through the glasses. User is able to send messages while watching. It pauses the video and then gets back to playing after. The same principle applies for an incoming message.
The process of messaging while watching a video seemed smooth by observation. User was focused on the video.
User seems well engaged in the scavenger hunt.
Meta stopped responding at a point. Had to reconnect and then it worked

The audio call disconnected at a point. Bluetooth disconnected. Disconnecting & reconnecting WhatsApp didn’t solve it. After restarting the phone, user could hear it ring through the glasses but couldn’t hear the voice come through.

Couldn’t successfully hold an audio call through the glasses. The phone call audio switched to regular phone sound when the call starts. This does not necessarily disconnect the actual Bluetooth connection between the phone and the device. Watching other videos seemed fine except the call.
Switched device to box #9 because there were issues with the audio call on the previous device through WhatsApp as noted earlier.
